骽字的基本解释

骽
tuǐ
古同“腿”。

骽字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tuǐ］
［《廣韻》吐猥切，上賄，透。］
亦作“蹆1”。亦作“骽1”。
(1)胫和股的总称。人和动物用来支持身体和行走的部分。俗称胫为小腿，股为大腿。
(2)指器物、用品上像腿那样起支撑作用的部分。
(3)特指腌制的猪腿。俗称火腿。
(4)我国拳术的一种名称。
(5)俚语。指男性生殖器。

骽字的康熙字典解释

【亥集上】【骨字部】　骽； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1449第22
【廣韻】【集韻】?吐猥切。與腿同。【玉篇】股也。

骽
Basic explanation of words
骽
tuǐ
Ancient with "legs".
骽
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tuǐ］
["Guangyun" vomiting and cutting, bribing, and thorough. ]
Also known as "蹆1". Also known as "骽1".
(1) The general term for shin and thigh. The part that people and animals use to support their bodies and walking. The shin is commonly known as the calf, and the thigh is the thigh.
(2) Refers to the supporting parts of utensils and articles like legs.
(3) Especially marinated pork leg. Commonly known as ham.
(4) A name of Chinese boxing.
(5) Slang. Refers to the male genitalia.
骽
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Ji 1] [Bone Character Department] 　骽; Kangxi strokes: 17; Page number: page 1449 22
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun]? Spit and cut. Same as the legs. [Jade articles] shares also.
